name: Renegade Wishes
description: A wayward vessel flees the surface of the planet of fantasies, almost hitting another ship as it does. But does the pilot's desperation reveal something more sinister about the planet itself? Confront the fleeing pilot and learn the truth!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using B. Sisko, Iden, Archer, Innovators, Luau Q, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Raven, La Sirena, or the Ferengi D'Kora Marauder will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: B. Sisko, Iden, Archer, Innovators or Luau Q

featured_crew.name: Zimmerman
featured_crew.flavor: Doctor Lewis Zimmerman arrives on Deep Space Nine to use Bashir as the model for his new Long-term Medical Hologram.

action.name: I'm Here To Make You Immortal

featured_crew.name: Iden
featured_crew.flavor: Iden led a rebellion of sentient holograms against their Hirogen creators, who made them to serve as prey for training simulations.

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Ferengi D'Kora Marauder
ship.flavor: An enigmatic vessel used for battle and transport. Capable of disabling a deflector shield.

rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

action.name: I'm Here To Make You Immortal

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Doctor Lewis Zimmerman arrives on Deep Space Nine to use Bashir as the model for his new Long-term Medical Hologram.

action.name: I'm Here To Make You Immortal

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Got ourselves a bit of a problem, Captain. A ship took off from the surface of Elpis V like a bat of hell and barely missed knocking another ship right out of the sky."
"Ship's maneuvering like she's being piloted by a rookie, but whoever it is isn't answering our hails. We'd appreciate it if you'd help round her up for us."
"Got ourselves a bit of a problem, Captain. A ship took off from the surface of Elpis V like a bat of hell and barely missed knocking another ship right out of the sky."
"Ship's maneuvering like she's being piloted by a rookie, but whoever it is isn't answering our hails. We'd appreciate it if you'd help round her up for us."
"I don't believe it. A hologram's piloting that ship. Even with a holoemitter or access to the ship's computer, how is that even possible?"

"Desperation can make you do what once seemed impossible. Surely that hologram was exhausted, serving the fantasies of the throngs of new visitors, every hour of every day. I died thousands of deaths for the amusement of the Hirogen. I can only imagine."

responses.text: "It seems rather elementary, doesn't it, Detective?"
"Holograms are merely light and energy; not flesh and blood like the rest of us."

screens.text: "Indeed, it is a vexing question we have before us. If a hologram can feel despair and exhaustion, wouldn't that make them sentient enough to deserve the basic rights we extend to all sentient lifeforms. What do you say, Captain?"
"As someone who once had to fight for his own basic rights, to prove his own sentience, it certainly does. And yet it is obvious that we still have a long way to go when it comes to holograms."
"Yeah, I guess so. Holograms aren't a monolith and who's to say what the difference is between someone's empty holodeck fantasy and a hologram who's taken on a life of its own?"

"There are members of the Breen Confederacy who do not even have blood flowing through them, but yet you still observe rules when engaging them, as you would any other hostile faction. So you'd show your enemy more grace than you would a hologram?"
"Anyway, we better save the philosophy lesson for later. At the rate that ship's going, he's gonna kill somebody. Bring the ship back and we can worry about it then."
"I don't believe it. A hologram's piloting that ship. Even with a holoemitter or access to the ship's computer, how is that even possible?"

"Desperation can make you do what once seemed impossible. Surely that hologram was exhausted, serving the fantasies of the throngs of new visitors, every hour of every day. I died thousands of deaths for the amusement of the Hirogen. I can only imagine."

"Holograms are merely light and energy; not flesh and blood like the rest of us."

"As someone who once had to fight for his own basic rights, to prove his own sentience, it certainly does. And yet it is obvious that we still have a long way to go when it comes to holograms."
"Yeah, I guess so. Holograms aren't a monolith and who's to say what the difference is between someone's empty holodeck fantasy and a hologram who's taken on a life of its own?"

"There are members of the Breen Confederacy who do not even have blood flowing through them, but yet you still observe rules when engaging them, as you would any other hostile faction. So you'd show your enemy more grace than you would a hologram?"
"Anyway, we better save the philosophy lesson for later. At the rate that ship's going, he's gonna kill somebody. Bring the ship back and we can worry about it then."
